item.title: Johnson urges caution as Covid rules ease in England
item.description: There will be no limit on how many people can meet, nightclubs can reopen and large events resume.

item.title: Pegasus: Spyware sold to governments 'targets activists'
item.description: Israeli tech firm NSO denies media reports that its software has been sold to authoritarian regimes.

item.title: Horse racing: Thousands of racehorses killed in slaughterhouses
item.description: Some horses once trained by some of racingâ€™s top names are being slaughtered, BBC Panorama finds.

item.title: Covid: Home-education numbers rise by 75%
item.description: "Covid anxiety" is among the explanations for the increasing popularity of out-of-school teaching.

item.title: Covid: Global healthcare workers missing out on jabs
item.description: Campaigners say millions have not had even one vaccine dose, raising concerns for their communities.

item.title: Olympics: Eight self-isolating from Team GB
item.description: Two South Africa footballers test positive for Covid-19 in Olympic village, while eight Team GB athletes and staff isolating as close contacts.

item.title: Covid: Double-jabbed NHS staff could avoid isolation if service under pressure
item.description: Fully-vaccinated health workers in England could skip quarantine if services come under pressure.

item.title: Covid: Restrictions ease as Scotland moves to level zero
item.description: The whole of Scotland has now moved to the lowest level of Covid regulations.

item.title: Europe floods: Merkel shocked by 'surreal' devastation
item.description: The chancellor vows to fast-track aid after visiting some of the worst-hit areas in western Germany.

item.title: Kurt Westergaard, Danish cartoonist behind Muhammad cartoon, dies at 86
item.description: His 2005 drawing of the Prophet Muhammad sparked protests across the Muslim world.

item.title: Esraa Abdel Fattah: Egyptian activist released from prison
item.description: Esraa Abdel Fattah earned the moniker "Facebook Girl" for her role in the 2011 revolution.

item.title: Thousands of orders cancelled after Ocado robot fire
item.description: The online grocer says the blaze was caused by a collision between robots at one of its warehouses.

item.title: Oil producing nations agree deal to control prices
item.description: The Opec cartel and Russia will boost supply which should see petrol prices at the pumps come down.

item.title: The Papers: 'Freedom day farce' and PM's isolation 'flip flopping'
item.description: Monday's papers are dominated by the news the PM and chancellor are self-isolating ahead of the lifting of Covid rules in England.

item.title: Why I've hosted more than 30 refugees in my house
item.description: Karina Litvack has housed dozens of refugees in London since her daughters moved out.

item.title: Lex Gillette: Record-breaking blind long jumper
item.description: With the support of his sighted guide, the four-time Paralympic medallist hopes to win gold in Tokyo.

item.title: Covid: 'The shift to online has been life-changing'
item.description: Jase Puddicombe, 27, says the rise of digital services has improved access for disabled people.

item.title: Protesting India farmers brave cold, heat and Covid
item.description: Seven months on, farmers are still striking against contentious new laws outside the national capital.

item.title: Covid: Face mask rules relax but what do workers think?
item.description: It is no longer a legal requirement to wear a face covering in England, but some employees are nervous.

item.title: Olympics: Defying threats, Iranian athletes speak out to back ban
item.description: Olympics organisers are being urged to investigate allegations of threats, discrimination and abuse.

item.title: Using plastic waste to help solve sand shortages
item.description: With construction sand in short supply crushed plastic is being used as an alternative.

item.title: How to cool your home in a warming world
item.description: Low-energy designs and technologies can keep homes comfortable, come rain or shine.

item.title: Under the skin of OnlyFans
item.description: A BBC investigation reveals concerns about how the site, known for porn, is structured and moderated.

item.title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: Unvaccinated patients with many regrets
item.description: The number of Covid patients in Bradford Royal Infirmary is rising sharply - and half are unvaccinated.

item.title: World Student Games: Sheffield's forgotten sporting spectacle
item.description: Sheffield's decision to host the World Student Games in 1991 still divides opinions across the city.

item.title: Verstappen brands Hamilton 'disrespectful' after British GP crash
item.description: Max Verstappen accuses Lewis Hamilton of being "disrespectful" and "unsportsmanlike" following their crash in the British Grand Prix.

item.title: Morikawa holds off Spieth to win Claret Jug on Open debut - report & highlights
item.description: Collin Morikawa shoots a scintillating bogey-free final round to win the 149th Open Championship by two shots from Jordan Spieth at Royal St George's.

item.title: Spinners star as England beat Pakistan to set up T20 series decider - report & highlights
item.description: England's spinners squeeze Pakistan to claim an emphatic 45-run victory in the second Twenty20 and level the series at 1-1.

item.title: Cavendish denied record 35th Tour stage win as Pogacar wins second yellow jersey
item.description: Mark Cavendish fails in his bid to set a new record of 35 stage wins in the Tour de France as Wout van Aert wins the final stage of the 2021 Tour.

item.title: Hamilton fights back from penalty to claim famous British GP win
item.description: Lewis Hamilton fights back from 10-second penalty for a crash with rival Max Verstappen to pass Charles Leclerc and win dramatic British Grand Prix.

item.title: The Open 2021: Morikawa's bogey-free final round seals victory on Open debut
item.description: American debutant Collin Morikawa shoots a bogey-free final round to finish top of the Open leader board and claim the Claret Jug at Royal St George's.

item.title: England v Pakistan T20: Liam Livingstone smashes six out of Headingley - twice!
item.description: Liam Livingstone smashes two sixes out of Headingley as England face Pakistan in their second T20 match of the three-match series.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing when restrictions end on 19 July?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules take effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks will no longer be compulsory in England from 19 July, but will remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: 'Covid passports': How can the NHS Covid Pass prove I've had both jabs?
item.description: Clubbers and people attending mass events in England could have to prove they've had both Covid jabs.

item.title: Covid: Who has to self-isolate and what if I'm fully vaccinated?
item.description: Rules on self-isolation are being eased in England for children and fully vaccinated adults.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Covid: Why is social distancing coming to an end?
item.description: Social distancing rules are changing across the UK.

item.title: Covid: What do over-18s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The vaccine rollout is now available for younger adults. What do they need to know about getting jabbed?

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: The EU vaccine 'passport' and what it means for travel
item.description: An EU vaccine "passport" is being introduced, enabling holders to prove they have been jabbed.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Medical teams around the world are learning which medicines work best against Covid.

item.title: 'Indians don't talk about sex - so I help them'
item.description: An Indian sex coach says parents turn to her for advice as sex education is not available in schools.

item.title: Ghana's Kojo Marfo: Sell-out show for butcher-turned-painter
item.description: He's got rock star fans and two sold-out shows to his name, but Kojo Marfo prefers life's simple joys.

item.title: Fire lookouts: The US Forest Service lookouts watching for fires
item.description: In remote towers, US Forest Service lookouts act as an early warning system for forest fires.

item.title: Virgin Galactic: Richard Branson's long, winding path to space
item.description: The BBC tracks the long, winding road to Sir Richard Branson's flight to the edge of space.

item.title: Bibaa and Nicole: The life after death of two sisters
item.description: Bibaa Henry and Nicole Smallman died in a senseless attack. But they should not be remembered as victims.
